programme.desc: In Smith County, Clarke and Temple deal with a forest fire and help a distressed pelican. Bailey and McMahen stop a boater with controlled substances onboard

programme.desc: Jeff and his team head to a remote town where they encounter an unexpected animal. In Denver, Dr Amy treats a kitten with a mysterious injury

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Otto buries a giant water tank to solve a few shortage issues. Atz Lee and Atz Sr seek out a black bear, and Eivin builds a survival motorbike fitted with weapons

programme.title: Mountain Monsters
programme.sub-title: The Secret of the Red Shed
programme.desc: The hunters track down one of the mysterious cloaked figures at the heart of the Spearfinger mystery. However, the red shed might hold all the answers

programme.title: A Garden in Snowdonia
programme.desc: With Bodnant lying under a blanket of snow, head gardener Troy Scott Smith plans a winter-themed display to attract more visitors. Plus, a 300-year-old oak succumbs to age, and moles wreak havoc on the teams preparations for the new season

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: On the last leg of his epic journey across the north of England, narrowboater Robbie Cumming tackles the fast-flowing River Ouse and is forced to make an emergency stop. His destination is Ripon Basin at the outer reaches of Britains inland waterways

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Margo is horrified by the prospect of dressing in saucy clothes for her music societys production of Sweet Charity, and Tom discovers oil in his garden. Classic comedy, starring Richard Briers and Penelope Keith

programme.title: Yes, Prime Minister
programme.desc: Hacker attempts to gain support for his tax cuts - by threatening to raise the duty on tobacco. Political comedy, starring Paul Eddington and Nigel Hawthorne

programme.title: How the Celts Saved Britain
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dan Snow unravels the mystery of the lost years of 400-800AD, looking at the demise of civilisation in Britain following the collapse of the Roman Empire, and revealing how Christianity transformed Ireland into a cultural powerhouse

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: The journey of Katya, a young welder, who is unexpectedly forced to care for her vulnerable half-sister, which leads her to confront painful memories and an estranged family. Cameras follow the sisters as they grow closer, and Katya faces an impossible decision - one that could change both their lives forever

programme.title: Imagine
programme.sub-title: Tom Jones - What Good Am I?
programme.desc: Alan Yentob meets the singer and coach on The Voice UK, who has sold more than 100 million albums, hosted a successful TV variety show and headlined at some of the biggest venues in Las Vegas. Including contributions by fellow musicians Jools Holland, Sandie Shaw, Robbie Williams, Cerys Matthews and Kelly Jones. First shown in 2010

programme.title: A Garden in Snowdonia
programme.desc: With Bodnant lying under a blanket of snow, head gardener Troy Scott Smith plans a winter-themed display to attract more visitors. Plus, a 300-year-old oak succumbs to age, and moles wreak havoc on the teams preparations for the new season

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: On the last leg of his epic journey across the north of England, narrowboater Robbie Cumming tackles the fast-flowing River Ouse and is forced to make an emergency stop. His destination is Ripon Basin at the outer reaches of Britains inland waterways

programme.title: 40 Minutes
programme.desc: A look at 48 hours in the life of the Angel London Underground station, from the daily round of fraught commuters to overburdened lifts and cancelled trains. The programme also follows the nightly activities of fluffers, women who clean rubbish off the tracks to avoid a fire hazard, and uncovers how gangs of men work to renovate parts of the track in almost pitch-black conditions. First broadcast 23 November 1989

programme.title: How the Celts Saved Britain
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dan Snow unravels the mystery of the lost years of 400-800AD, looking at the demise of civilisation in Britain following the collapse of the Roman Empire, and revealing how Christianity transformed Ireland into a cultural powerhouse

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.sub-title: Weatherman Walking: Dylans Walks - Swansea and Llansteffan
programme.desc: In the first of two special programmes originally shown to celebrate the centenary of Dylan Thomass birth, Derek Brockway strolls around the poets home town of Swansea. Accompanied by actor Adrian Metcalfe, Derek sets off from Dylans childhood home on Cwmdonkin Drive and walks through the citys parks and down to the seafront, before visiting some of the writers haunts in later life. He then heads west to the Llansteffan peninsula where his guide, artist Osi Rhys Osmond, leads him through the countryside that was home to many of Dylans relatives. They include his aunts farm, which would provide the inspiration for the poem Fernhill

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Narrowboater Robbie Cumming begins a fresh set of adventures along the waterways of the north of England and the Midlands. He is forced to make a running repair to his narrowboat the Naughty Lass while on the Tinsley lock flight in South Yorkshire. He then cruises beneath Conisbroughs magnificent viaduct and must wait for an unusual sliding railway bridge to open on the Stainforth and Keadby Canal

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc: Richard Miles concludes his series charting the history of archaeological breakthroughs by discovering more about the ancient common man. The investigation takes the archaeologist from the elaborate grave of Egyptian boy king Tutankhamun to the Danish resting place of the Tollund Man, who died as part of an Iron Age sacrifice more than 2,000 years ago

programme.title: Thatcher: A Very British Revolution
programme.desc: The concluding part of the documentary looks at how Margaret Thatchers leadership style and the issues of Europe and the poll tax split her cabinet and created public anger, leading to her downfall. Protests against the poll tax resulted in violence in central London, but more damagingly there was widespread disenchantment in Tory strongholds across the country. Fractures emerge with senior cabinet colleagues, worsened by her European policy and Geoffrey Howes resignation leads to a leadership challenge

programme.title: David Hare Remembers - The Absence of War
programme.desc: Playwright and screenwriter David Hare looks back on the television adaptation of his stage play, The Absence of War - a fictional account of a Labour General Election campaign. He talks about the joys of working with a cast drawn mainly from the National Theatre company that originally performed it, and discusses the universal themes the play covers

programme.title: Screen Two
programme.desc: John Thaw stars in David Hares political drama based on his stage play about a Labour MP who finds himself campaigning against his own party. First broadcast 18 May 1995

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Paul Yates explores the fascination he shares with pop artist Peter Blake for enigmatic wrestler Kendo Nagasaki - a man who never speaks or removes his mask. First broadcast 31 January 1992

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.sub-title: Weatherman Walking: Dylans Walks - Swansea and Llansteffan
programme.desc: In the first of two special programmes originally shown to celebrate the centenary of Dylan Thomass birth, Derek Brockway strolls around the poets home town of Swansea. programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Caught
programme.desc: The Flying Squad hunt for a brazen gang stealing jewellery and cash across the UK. And a daring heist of valuable rare books sets police off on an international manhunt

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts struggles to keep his balance at a Liverpool house that feels like its sloping away. Jacqui Joseph is worried about the damp at a property in Kent and Tommy Walsh thinks a layout change is in order at a one-bedroom flat in London

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp hosts from Newark in Nottinghamshire, with experts Ben Cooper and Izzie Balmer helping the teams choose items with profit potential to take to auction. Natasha meets a former Bargain Hunt contestant with a world record collection of bagpipes before having a go herself

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Trackers Jason and Alan are in Maidenhead, closing in on a stolen hire car. But before they get to it, the vehicle pulls away. Former racing driver Mark McCann details how his Lamborghini, worth a staggering £220,000, was stolen by a criminal gang

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: The detectorist team search for a wedding ring lost on a family holiday on the shores of Derwent Water and the hunt is on for the owner of an expensive lost smartwatch

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Denise Nurse shows off the magnificent Scottish Borders in all their glory to a young couple looking to make a big countryside escape. One of the pair wants to open a veterinary practice in the region, and the other needs outbuildings for cars and motorbikes. Fortunately, they are both united by their love of the Great Outdoors

programme.title: The Repair Shop on the Road
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea and Will Kirk travel around the UK fixing historical treasures, with this edition seeing them visit the Scottish Boat Building School in Irvine, North Ayrshire, to restore a three-piece canoe designed in the 1930s. Will also calls in to Barr Castle in Galston, East Ayrshire, to repair a windowpane with a hand inscription by Robert Burns

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, which could be anything from zero to £4,000, before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Phil Wang

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Quiz night in the Vic ends abruptly as everyone reels from Kats bombshell. When she realises Zoes actions are impacting her business and family, she gives her daughter an ultimatum. Meanwhile, Suki and Eve take a positive step, and Oscar turns detective

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey and a team of experts help the Appleyards, a lively family of six, declutter their three-bedroom home and let go of half of their belongings to pave the way for a reorganised future. With all their belongings displayed in a warehouse, the family discover they own over 2,000 greetings cards, 74 Christmas pinecones and 99 odd socks

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: As hospitals in Yorkshire face overwhelming pressure, Bridlington crew Adam and Joe prove laughter is the best medicine as they care for an elderly patient with stroke symptoms. Meanwhile, Hull-based paramedics Gretel and Alisha and Scarborough-based duo Tracey and Lauren are simultaneously dispatched to emergencies - a 59-year-old woman left with a limb-threatening injury after a dog attack and an 80-year-old who has collapsed at home

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Hell for Leather: The Story of Gaelic Football
programme.desc: Documentary delving into the role of Gaelic football in the sporting, cultural and social history of modern Ireland. Modern masters explore its appeal, with Brian Fenton pouring out his passion for a game that conquered his home city of Dublin, and Tyrones Seán Cavanagh revealing the depth of emotions he felt when he won the All-Ireland and brought home the Sam Maguire cup for the first time

programme.title: Scream 3
programme.desc: Three survivors of the original Woodsboro massacre reunite when a killer dons the infamous ghost mask and strikes during the production of a movie based on their experiences. As they try to determine the identity of the murderer, Sidney discovers a troubling link to her past, forcing her to confront her demons once and for all. Horror sequel, starring Neve Campbell, David Arquette and Courteney Cox

programme.title: Crimewatch Caught
programme.desc: How CCTV of a change of tracksuit unlocked the truth about a senseless murder. Plus, a report on how South Wales Police disrupted a huge drugs gang

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell, Jacqui Joseph and Dion Dublin check out a beachside hideaway in Bognor, a characterful granite building in Aberdeen and a two-bedroom property that could magically become a four-bedroom terrace in Lancashire

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian presents as two teams, coached by Kate Bliss and Izzie Balmer, search for some antique bargains at Builth Wells antiques fair in mid-Wales. Kates team, mother and daughter-in-law Sandra and Rachel, find a Victorian boot scraper while Izzies blue team, Dale and Dave, discover an old ships wheel and an art deco-style teapot with a picture of Eric Knowles inside

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: A Ferrari owner is shocked to see CCTV footage of his beloved car being stolen by machete-wielding crooks. Luckily, a specialist tracking company is on a mission to get it back

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: The detectorists search for a ring lost on a family farm nearly half a century ago and social media detective Mui tries to track down the owner of a medal that washed up on a beach. Crafter Sally gets to work on transforming a delivery of rubbish into newly treasured items

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A couple from Reading in Berkshire want to escape and set up home in the Welsh Borders, somewhere with enough land to keep a menagerie of animals. Steve Brown helps them with the property search and takes them to an animal sanctuary to meet Burrito, a cuddle-loving donkey, as well as two pampered pigs, Wilbur and Uncle Watson

programme.title: The Repair Shop on the Road
programme.desc: Dominic Chinea is joined by an Inverness plastering expert to try to preserve art painted by Polish soldiers on the walls of the attic of Nairn Museum during the Second World War. Will Kirk is in Beauly to meet Alan MacPherson, who instructs him in the intricacies of creating shinty sticks to stand up to the rigours of this hard-fought game

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: JB Gill co-hosts the magazine show, with celebrity guests and stories of interest from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Halloween is off to a bad start for Alfie when the burst sewer pipe leaks in the barrel store, but as he cleans up, Alfie discovers a VHS tape from 1980s. Meanwhile, Anthony steps in to defuse a situation, and Eve faces a new hurdle

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Shoemaker Dean Westmoreland and plastics expert Charlotte Abbott team up to restore a pair of motorcycle racing goggles with a rich history, Tim Gunn fixes a 1950s butchers bike and Will Kirk repairs a toy boat hand-made by a devoted father. Art conservator Lucia Scalisi sets out to revive a mysterious painting found in the attic of a family farmhouse in Wales

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: As morning breaks, breakfast proves to be a wake-up call for the faithful as the traitors strike again. Bridges need to be built if the celebrity players hope to add money to the prize fund, but with protection from murder on offer, some may be more interested in looking after number one. At the round table, suspicions continue to rise. Can the traitors deflect accusations, or will the faithful see through their lies? Presented by Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: In My Own Words
programme.sub-title: In My Own Words: Tom Jones
programme.desc: The singer reflects on his extraordinary life and career in song, from his proud working-class roots in the Welsh valleys to TV studios and the music worlds most glittering stages. Its a journey that spans more than 80 years and is still going strong. But as he reveals, it hasnt always been easy, as he has juggled fame and family, and suffered great loss along the way

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: Part one of two. After a video featuring a female prison officer and an inmate having sex inside HMP Wandsworth goes viral, journalist Mobeen Azhar begins an investigation into what happened and why. A year of twists, turns and damning revelations pulls back the curtain on a dangerous wider world of coercion, corruption and contraband thriving behind bars

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mobeen Azhars investigation into prison corruption uncovers the murder of a former officer who had been involved in exposing an illicit relationship. When news breaks of a prison governor being jailed for a relationship with a drug-dealing gang boss, Mobeen becomes determined to uncover the true extent of criminal influence inside our prisons

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A celebration of some of historys greatest females, including Spartan Queen Gorgo terrorising Historical Love Island, supergroup The Tudor Queens, and the original Wonder Women

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: The history of our relationship with animals - Charles Darwin presents Yummy Planet, Elizabeth Is menagerie has some lion trouble, and farting fish almost start a nuclear war

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio travel to Italy to test high-performance hatchbacks. Jeremy Clarkson is in the Citroen DS3 Racing, Richard Hammond champions the Fiat 500C Abarth and James May makes the case for the Renaultsport Clio 200 Cup as they navigate their way round baffling Italian towns and take part in a scavenger hunt, before putting the cars through their paces on the F1 street circuit in Monaco. Also, petrolhead comedian Ross Noble is in the Reasonably Priced Car and the McLaren MP4-12C supercar comes under review

programme.title: Our Girl
programme.desc: Worried about Georgies state of mind, Jamie seeks out Captain James to find out whether she is in any danger. Meanwhile, Georgie reels after hearing the news that Abu is alive and closer to her than she realises. Starring Michelle Keegan and Luke Pasqualino

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: Part one of two. programme.title: Twisted Metal
programme.desc: John and Quiet make a pitstop, where John reunites with a former contact. Sweet Tooth bonds with a new follower

programme.title: Twisted Metal
programme.desc: John is faced with the ultimate decision between honouring his past or embracing his future

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Joe meets young dads who are navigating the highs and lows of fatherhood, looking back on his own experiences as a parent and sparking wider conversations about masculinity, the importance of positive male role models, and why its time for young dads to be seen, heard, supported - and celebrated. Reflecting on how becoming a father in his mid-twenties changed his life, he meets four young dads who, like he once did, are navigating the challenges of parenting and are determined to challenge stigma, overcome hardship and redefine what fatherhood looks like today

programme.title: Charlie Coopers Myth Country
programme.desc: The writer and actor tours the UK in his campervan, exploring local legends, myths and folklore and gathering evidence in a bid to get to the truth. He begins by going in search of Black Shuck, the demon dog of East Anglia, attempting an overnight stakeout to capture it on film, with unexpected consequences

programme.title: Charlie Coopers Myth Country
programme.desc: The writer and actor heads to Wiltshire, home to ancient sites such as Stonehenge, Avebury and the Westbury chalk horse, to get to the bottom of why humans feel the need to leave marks on the landscape. He turns his investigation towards the far more recent phenomenon of crop circles, hoping to settle a debate that has plagued his family for years. They think that crop circles are the work of aliens, but Charlie strongly doubts that belief

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mobeen Azhars investigation into prison corruption uncovers the murder of a former officer who had been involved in exposing an illicit relationship. When news breaks of a prison governor being jailed for a relationship with a drug-dealing gang boss, Mobeen becomes determined to uncover the true extent of criminal influence inside our prisons

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Dara O Briain joins Rattus for a show marking the 1969 moon landings. The first use of rocket power, the Space Race, and poo floating in the Apollo 10 cockpit - its all here

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Dani Dyer becomes Rattus political advisor for tales of parliamentary people and plots

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May try to make train travel cheaper, faster and more interesting, replacing the locomotive with a specially modified car and the carriages with a series of caravans. Comedy star Rowan Atkinson gets behind the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car and Jeremy drives the Jaguar XKR-S and a Nissan GT-R round the track to compare both models

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Alexandra Palace in north London, venue of the BBCs first ever television broadcast, stages the south of England heat, as comics Blank Peng, Fab Goualin, Sharifa Butterfly, Sydney May and Evaldas Karosas battle it out to book their place in this years grand final showdown. Host Sara Pascoe is joined by stand-up comics Catherine Bohart and Michael Odewale, who appear alongside Fatiha El-Ghorri on the panel of judges

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Horror-themed episode of the comedy in which the gang learns the Archer is facing demolition and breaks in the night before to bid the place farewell. However, the friends soon find themselves trapped inside the sinister pub - where strange forces are intent on killing them. Ralf Little stars

programme.title: Scream
programme.desc: The students of a high school are stalked by a masked knife-wielding maniac with a love of scary movies and a penchant for playing mind games with his prey. One of the girls on his hit list begins to suspect there is a connection between the killer and her mothers murder a year previously. Wes Cravens horror, which satirises the genres cliches, starring Neve Campbell, David Arquette and Courteney Cox

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, the Ghost and the Gravestone
programme.desc: Radio presenter Sian Eleri investigates the paranormal activity at Penyffordd Farm in north Wales, the house being widely considered the most haunted house in Britain in the late 1990s. She begins by meeting with specialist psychologist Dr Daniels who was called in by the family living on the farm at the time when they became desperate for answers for the strange activity in their home. The doctor explains that of the many apparently paranormal cases of his career, this was the one that stayed with him and still perplexes him to this day

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, the Ghost and the Gravestone
programme.desc: Sian Eleri meets the current owner of Penyffordd, who bought the farmhouse despite the stories of its haunting. Dr Daniels suggests that moving the gravestone on the property is what started the paranormal activity, leading Sian to investigate if there really is a girl buried in the garden

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, the Ghost and the Gravestone
programme.desc: Sian Eleris investigation into the reported haunting of Penyffordd Farm continues as multiple witnesses claim to see a hooded figure. Could they all have imagined the same thing? As she listens to recordings the original investigator made, Sian discovers the Welsh words for disabled and child had allegedly appeared on the walls. Sian meets with one of the Gower daughters to ask whether at the time she believed that to be the monk apparition focusing in one family member

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, the Ghost and the Gravestone
programme.desc: Unable to meet Rose-Mary or David, Sian Eleri visits an exorcist to find out what he believes removing a spirit from the house would entail. She speaks to the daughters of the couple that owned the house at the height of the haunting to question them one last time and Dr Daniels finds a similar case in Spain that might provide a clue as to how the haunting might have been a hoax

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: After his fathers death, Archie inherits the failing family business - A Better Place Funeral Home. Archie, his sister Moira and cousin Ron try to stop the business falling into the hands of international corporate chain Sympathy Plus. Comedy short, starring Jacob Topen

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: Part one of two. After a video featuring a female prison officer and an inmate having sex inside HMP Wandsworth goes viral, journalist Mobeen Azhar begins an investigation into what happened and why. A year of twists, turns and damning revelations pulls back the curtain on a dangerous wider world of coercion, corruption and contraband thriving behind bars

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug treats Carrie to laser eye surgery for her birthday - but the side effects leave her blind for a week, and shes not happy to learn her husband chose the cheapest doctor he could find

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Dougs colleagues resent his achievement in breaking the record for perfect deliveries, while Carrie wonders why the dog walker enjoys spending time with her father. Comedy, starring Kevin James

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray is annoyed to discover Marie is plying his brother with gifts of scented candles and massage oils. However, his mood changes when he deduces her real motive - to put Robert in a romantic mood, in the hope he will provide her with grandchildren

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Amys brother Peter turns to Ray for advice on talking to women, while Debra decides to help out by throwing a party and inviting all her single friends

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra nags Raymond to tidy up after himself, but he is more concerned with a letter he has received from his sporting hero - which accidentally ends up in the bin

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles has too much to drink at a Halloween party, and Frasier is taken aback to discover the children in his complex are afraid of him. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Domestic disharmony causes chaos in Frasiers apartment, leaving Martins beloved chair ruined and the carpet soiled. Meanwhile, Roz begins piano lessons. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer, John Mahoney and Jane Leeves

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The Seattle shrink celebrates his 2,000th radio broadcast and is disappointed to find he has a recording of every show but one, forcing him to turn to an obsessive fan for a copy of the elusive tape. Guest starring computer tycoon Bill Gates

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier befriend Kirby, whose girlfriends grandfather is a well-known wine connoisseur. Martin is forced to wear a device to monitor his blood pressure. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.desc: Frank Fritz is tempted to go for broke when he spots the perfect oil can, and the spending spree continues at a mansion

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: The Spanish bar owners become cocktail waiters and work on the French farmhouse progresses under a tight schedule. In Alicante, a luxury wedding venue suffers a setback

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole decides that he needs to restore a forklift truck, while Simon OBrien gets all zen with a stone water feature

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host the words-and-numbers game where contestants pit their wits against the clock. Desiree Burch joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Leah Charles-King helps a couple to find a holiday home for them, their four children and eight grandchildren in the seaside town of Benalmádena on Spains Costa del Sol

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: Dan continues his mission to make the centrepiece of his chateau watertight and in western France, Patrick and Mihaela renovate a former workers lodge into holiday accommodation. In Italy, Lucie and Jerrys already earthquake-damaged village is dealt another blow as its hit by floods

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition continues at Ullswater View in the Lake District, where Julie and her friend Sarah plan to give the BandBers a touch of luxury. The group brave wet, windy conditions during a boat trip on the lake, and vibrant views from the breakfast room boost everyones spirits. Until a sausage causes a problem

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Second to host in Belfast is 39-year-old finance worker Andrea, whos throwing a Belfast-themed evening chock-full of local lingo and simple-but-effective fare. Kirsty is impressed by Andreas homemade pasta, but the spice isnt right for her in the starter. With lots of Belfast patter flying around, Aodhan leads the group in perfecting a local greeting which has the gang miming tractor driving. But will Jamess confession that hed rather eat bugs than cheesecake, and Donnas tattoo tale, leave a bad taste?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Foluke and Alex dream of owning a holiday home to escape the British winters and to rent out during the summer in Paphos, Cyprus. With a rich history and ancient ruins, Paphos is a UNESCO world heritage site and a very popular destination, boasting a laid-back lifestyle, stunning landscapes and beautiful beaches. Legend even has it that Aphrodite - the goddess of love - was born from the crystal-clear waters here. Jean Johansson shows Foluke and Alex five lovely options for their budget of up to £100,000, from a modern apartment with a homely feel to a light and bright harbourside apartment

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Alison Hammond and Noel Fielding present as the semi-finalists take on patisserie week, serving up cream horns and tackling a recipe for a sugar glass dome in the technical round. In the showstopper, they produce a macaron sculpture that depicts something meaningful to them, before judges Prue Leith and Paul Hollywood decide who will be going through to the final

programme.title: Worlds Apart
programme.desc: The treasure hunt heats up in Japans kitchen, Osaka, with only four teams left in the competition. In a series-first group challenge, the younger team members lean on their seniors, while favourite pairs find themselves at risk with low scores. The older contestants reflect on what theyve learned, opening themselves up to futures they never imagined. And a shock result shakes the coin count, sending an unlikely duo home

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Its a double dose of Claudia for the armchair critics as they watch the latest episodes of The Celebrity Traitors and Strictly Come Dancing. They also share their opinions on Hollyoaks, Dragons Den, Beat the Chasers, Celebrity Help! My House is Haunted and the BBC News reports about Prince Andrew

programme.title: Celebrity Gogglebox
programme.desc: Some of the nations top personalities turn their hand to being the countrys most opinionated viewers as they critique the weeks TV. Giving their view on the most talked about television of the week are Davina McCall with her partner Michael Douglas, Katherine Ryan and her husband Bobby, Jane McDonald and friend Sue, Rob Beckett and Tom Allen, Tom Grennan and his dad Martin, Munroe Bergdorf and Leomie Anderson, Stephen Mangan with his sister Anita, Chris Packham CBE with his step-daughter Megan, Big Zuu, Hyder and Tubsey, Paul Sinha and husband Olly, Nick Grimshaw and his niece Liv, Shaun Ryder and Bez, Martin and Roman Kemp, and Clare Balding and Alice Arnold. This time, they share their opinions on The 1% Club, Spy in The Ocean, Fake Profile, Five Star Kitchen: Britains Next Great Chef and The Yorkshire Vet

programme.title: Hunted
programme.desc: After a daring attempt to pick up £10,000 in Birmingham, two of the fugitives plunge headlong into a high-stakes race against the hunters as they try to leave the city. Vanishing into the Lake District seems like a perfectly brilliant idea for a solo fugitive, and two more contenders head for a family gathering as if home is the last place the hunters might be watching closely.

programme.title: Hunted
programme.desc: Two of the fugitives return to their hometown, where the hunters are waiting for them. Another pair prepare to split up for safetys sake, but an accidental encounter puts them directly in harms way. Short on money and resources, two of the runners have no choice but to reach out to friends. But the hunters see it coming and the pair must split up and have even fewer resources to draw upon as the net tightens

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker present the comic review of the past seven days events, rounding up the biggest and most entertaining news stories with the help of studio guests Richard Ayoade, Laura Smyth and Catherine Bohart

programme.title: Ramsays Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in to Connecticuts oldest inn, the Curtis House in Woodbury, which has been owned by the Hardisty family for generations. However, the business has started to fall apart and their legacy is on the brink of being lost. Siblings Chris and TJ, who are in charge, no longer speak to each other and the staff and guests feel stuck in the middle

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: Millions of workers in the UK could lose their jobs because of the artificial intelligence revolution. According to experts the impact on a range of industries could be dramatic, with skilled work particularly affected. As AI develops rapidly, with claims it can outperform humans in most tasks, Dispatches undertakes a bold and unique experiment that pitches human against machine to find out how true that is. Four professionals are invited into a specially-created test centre to compete in a set of identical tasks against their AI counterparts: a GP; a fashion photographer; a trainee solicitor; and a composer. With reputations as well as jobs at stake, who comes out on top - humans or AI?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: From radical rebuilds to awe-inspiring architecture, ambitious self-builders set out to make their bold property dreams come true

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil return to Edinburgh to visit Gary and Bill, after meeting them in 2020 to help them choose between to selling or renovating their house, to see what they decided. While Gary was packed and ready to move out of their four-bed Victorian cemetery lodge, Bill loved the unique features of their home and so the pair enlisted Kirstie and Phils help

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug smashes into Kelly and Deacons car, causing untold damage and a war of words on what should have been a pleasant evening out. Meanwhile, Kirby teases Spence when he discovers he has an allergy to nuts. Comedy, starring Kevin James and Leah Remini

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie is invited to a company gathering, where Doug impresses the other lawyers partners with tales of his fictitious mountaineering exploits. Back at home, Arthur wrecks their bedroom and enlists Deacons help in repairing the damage before they return

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug decorates the house for Halloween against Arthurs wishes - and then regrets it when the old man has a heart attack. programme.desc: An offhand comment to the twins new friend has dire consequences for Ray, who cannot understand why everyone is so upset - but he compounds his error by accidentally repeating the remark to the boys father. Ray Romano stars

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank puts salt on Maries home-made lasagne, causing her to think she is turning into a terrible cook, but Ray and Robert discover their father has lost his sense of taste - apparently because of a potency medication he is taking. programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Amy chats non-stop through a basketball game, and Ray responds by suggesting to Robert that she talks too much - a criticism she does not take well. Comedy, starring Monica Horan and Ray Romano

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: At Dans formerly secret settlement in France that played a heroic role during the Second World War, cameras meet a former resident who owes his life to his stay there. As the seasons change, mother nature presents new problems for Patrick and Mihaelas once-regal country estate while in Italy, having revived a former farming community, Lucie and Jerry attempt to turn a profit from their olive oil

programme.title: Four in a Bed

And while the food gets mixed reviews, an unexpected performance gets a standing ovation. Will his guests be thrilled, or will they be left in a state of terror?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sammie wants to find a holiday home for herself and her two daughters for family holidays, but also for girly weekends with her best friend Tash, whos joining her on the search. Sammies set on gorgeous Mallorca, with its stunning beaches, rich history and fabulous climate, and shes especially keen on vibrant party town Magaluf. Laura Hamilton shows Sammie and Tash five great properties for their budget of £180,000, from an apartment right next to her favourite bar in Magaluf to a place that takes a trip down memory lane in Alcudia

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet two couples taking advantage of a first-time buyer scheme to help them onto the property ladder in Essex, only to find their budgets wont take them very far. Kirstie is with locals Sarah and Charlie who need a home to bring them together after five years of living with their respective parents. Theyve started to lose their nerve after eight months of unsuccessful house-hunting and it quickly becomes clear that their best chance of success is to take on a project. Phils couple Toby and Simone have high expectations of what their home should be after renting in London, but their budget doesnt match up to the house, or postcode, theyre accustomed to

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets entrepreneur Piers and police officer Emma, who bought a folly next to their home in the West Midlands with plans to knock it down and replace it with a sprawling 21st-century castle. With plans to have a tower, castellations, a moat, arrow slits, loggia courtyards and futuristic technology, its set to be the first new listed castle in the UK for 100 years. It is also the biggest building ever featured on the show - and it doesnt take long before the couples budget begins to soar

programme.title: New Zealands Best Homes with Phil Spencer
programme.desc: Phil explores three properties that have been designed to capture scenery in unique locations - from a beach house with uninterrupted sea views of the Coromandel coast to an alpine home near Queenstown with elevated vistas across land and lake. The final home is a cleverly placed property on the shore of Lake Wanaka that perfectly frames the surrounding mountains

programme.title: Britains Most Expensive Houses
programme.desc: Broker Mark Coulter hopes a glowing review will sell £3.5 million Ormiston Castle close to Edinburgh, and Ian Lillicrap lists a five-bedroom Cornish cottage with 11 acres and stunning coastal views. Fine and Countrys managing director Nicky Stevenson visits Jerseys most exclusive properties with broker Margaret Thompson, of Real Housewives of Jersey fame. Their aim is to find a buyer for £21 million Cardington House, a mega mansion with direct beach access

programme.title: Suranne Jones: Investigating Witch Trials
programme.desc: Part one of two. The actress investigates the most infamous witch trials in history and explores their legacy today, beginning in the Lancashire town of Pendle, where she grew up, which was the site of one of the most notorious mass executions for witchcraft in English history. She also travels to Germany, the epicentre of brutal witch trials that swept through Europe 400 years ago

programme.title: Suranne Jones: Investigating Witch Trials
programme.desc: Part two of two. Surannes investigation takes her to the site of the most infamous witch trials of all - the American town of Salem. Suranne discovers how the phrase witch hunt is being used today by powerful men, like Donald Trump, to paint themselves as victims, and how the Salem legacy continues to impact the rights of women today

programme.title: Ramsays Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Pipestone, Minnesota, where he checks in to Historic Calumet Inn. Joint owners Vanda and Rina Smrkovski were given the hotel as a gift by their father, but after just nine months in charge, their staff are on the brink of revolt, and guests are expressing their dissatisfaction with the accommodation. Gordon quickly realises the sisters need to grow up fast if hes going to have a chance of saving the business

programme.title: Iris Prize Best British Shorts
programme.desc: A selection of films nominated for the prestigious 2025 Iris Prize for Best British Short exploring what we hold onto and what we cannot. A historical sanctuary; a surrealist exploration of belonging; a sinister choice; a tumultuous sibling dynamic; forging a utopia. The films in this compilation are: Sweetheart, Soviet Fantasia, Lisbon, Man Enough and Two Black Boys in Paradise

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One in Vegas - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. The pals visit Las Vegas, where they find surprises galore awaiting them. Meanwhile, Ross misinterprets Rachels intentions and embarks on a campaign of public humiliation against her - but discovers she is more than a match for him

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One in Vegas - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Rachel makes Ross regret playing a prank on her, while Monica and Chandler have a spot of good luck and Joey tries out his latest get-rich-quick scheme. Comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston, David Schwimmer and Matthew Perry

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross and Rachel wake up the morning after their impromptu marriage and regret the hasty circumstances of the ceremony, while Monica and Chandler find that neither of them really wants to rush to the altar. Joey and Phoebe have a cross-country adventure. Comedy, starring David Schwimmer, Jennifer Aniston, Lisa Kudrow and Matt LeBlanc

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Hugs Rachel
programme.desc: Monica and Chandler decide to move in together, but have difficulty explaining to Rachel that she will not be a part of the arrangement. Meanwhile, Phoebe begs Ross to get his latest marriage annulled. American comedy, starring Jennifer Aniston and Courteney Cox

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Ross encourages Chandler and Monica to move in together and makes a dramatic decision about Rachel. David Schwimmer, Matthew Perry, Courteney Cox and Jennifer Aniston star

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Joey Loses His Insurance
programme.desc: Ross tries his hand at teaching and adopts an English accent in the process. Joey suffers a hernia and Rachel discovers her marriage has not been annulled. American comedy, starring Matt LeBlanc, David Schwimmer and Jennifer Aniston

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Joey is mistaken for the owner of a Porsche and uses the mix-up to enhance his image. Rachel forces Ross to annul their marriage, and Phoebe tries her best to look after the triplets. American comedy, starring Matt LeBlanc and Jennifer Aniston

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One on the Last Night
programme.desc: Joey and Chandler celebrate their last night as flatmates, and Ross claims he is too busy babysitting to help Monica as she frantically tries to arrange Rachels packing before the removal firm arrives. Comedy, starring Matt LeBlanc and Matthew Perry

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: An Australian dancer (guest star Elle Macpherson) moves in with Joey and he struggles to refrain from flirting. Chandler tries to impress Monica by cleaning their flat, and Rachel is embarrassed by Phoebes jogging style. Comedy, with Matt LeBlanc and Matthew Perry

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor and his son Barney arrive in Texas, where they enjoy driving around in tanks, experience space travel in a centrifuge and hear campfire tales about UFOs. First up, the pair undertake some centrifuge training, which is used to prepare astronauts for the crushing gravitational forces produced at take-off from the extreme exhilaration. They also head to the outskirts of Houston to meet some UFO enthusiasts who investigate claimed sightings of extra-terrestrials, and are gripped by stories of spaceships blocking roads and people being taken by aliens for experiments

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor and his son Barney embark on the final leg of their journey, which sees the pair arrive in the Louisiana city of New Orleans. Here, they visit a spiritual voodoo priest for a spot of energy cleansing, and feed alligators in the Bayou with Captain Billy, who knows every corner of the wetlands, having been born and raised on the bayous of South Louisiana. Later, Bradley hops on board the Natchez jazz Steamboat, before the pair take to the streets to lead a spectacular parade with a six-piece band

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Johnny Vegas, Vernon Kay, Paul Chowdhry and Katherine Ryan join regular team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock on the irreverent panel show, hosted by Jimmy Carr. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

Back on the ship, the trio need to knuckle down to some hard graft, prepping and rehearsing for a Las Vegas-style performance with solo singer Cassidy. programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Parts one. Classic adventure with the third Doctor and his companion Jo Grant. The pair arrive at Devils End, Wiltshire, where an archaeological dig has uncovered an ancient tomb called The Devils Hump. When they investigate they find that the tomb houses an evil entity under the control of an old enemy

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part two of five. The Master reveals himself as the guiding force behind Azal, the entity from within the Devils Hump. Trapping the Doctor within the tomb, the Master sends the gigantic Daemon to destroy his old adversary once and for all. Jon Pertwee and Roger Delgado star

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part three of five. Classic adventures with the third Doctor and his companion Jo Grant. programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part four of five. Jo and Yates are captured by the Master and his coven, becoming sacrificial offerings to the Daemon Azal. Meanwhile the hynotised villagers of Devils End launch their attack against the Doctor and UNIT. Starring Jon Pertwee, Katy Manning and Roger Delgado

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part five of five. With the fates of Jo and Yates hanging by a thread, the Brigadier attempts to penetrate the defensive forcefield surrounding the village church, providing the Doctor with an opportunity to go head-to-head with the Master and the increasingly volatile Azal. Starring Jon Pertwee

programme.desc: Part two of five. The Master reveals himself as the guiding force behind Azal, the entity from within the Devils Hump. Trapping the Doctor within the tomb, the Master sends the gigantic Daemon to destroy his old adversary once and for all. Jon Pertwee and Roger Delgado star

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part three of five. Classic adventures with the third Doctor and his companion Jo Grant. With the Daemon free, and bearing a remarkable resemblance to the devil, the Doctor must rally the terrified villagers to his cause. Meanwhile, the Master places a heat force-field around the village, preventing anyone from entering to foil his diabolical plans

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part four of five. Jo and Yates are captured by the Master and his coven, becoming sacrificial offerings to the Daemon Azal. Meanwhile the hynotised villagers of Devils End launch their attack against the Doctor and UNIT. Starring Jon Pertwee, Katy Manning and Roger Delgado

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.sub-title: The Curse of Peladon - Part One
programme.desc: The Ice Warriors help the Doctor fight treacherous factions who object to a galactic union on Peladon. Sci-fi classic, starring Jon Pertwee and Katy Manning

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.sub-title: The Curse of Peladon - Part Two
programme.desc: The Ice Warriors help the Doctor fight treacherous factions who object to a galactic union on Peladon. Sci-fi classic, starring Jon Pertwee and Katy Manning

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.sub-title: The Curse of Peladon - Part Three
programme.desc: The Ice Warriors help the Doctor fight treacherous factions who object to a galactic union on Peladon. Sci-fi classic, starring Jon Pertwee and Katy Manning

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.sub-title: The Curse of Peladon - Part Four
programme.desc: The Ice Warriors help the Doctor fight treacherous factions who object to a galactic union on Peladon. Sci-fi classic, starring Jon Pertwee and Katy ManningTroughton

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Parts one. Classic adventure with the third Doctor and his companion Jo Grant. The pair arrive at Devils End, Wiltshire, where an archaeological dig has uncovered an ancient tomb called The Devils Hump. When they investigate they find that the tomb houses an evil entity under the control of an old enemy

programme.title: Robin and Marian
programme.desc: Outlaw Robin Hood returns to England after the Crusades and goes in search of his beloved Marian, who is now an abbess, and crosses swords once again with old enemy the Sheriff of Nottingham. Medieval adventure, starring Sean Connery, Audrey Hepburn, Robert Shaw, Nicol Williamson, Ronnie Barker, Denholm Elliott and Richard Harris

programme.title: The Sound Barrier
programme.desc: An aircraft manufacturer risks alienating his friends and family in a single-minded attempt to prove planes can exceed the speed of sound. David Leans drama, written by Terence Rattigan and starring Ralph Richardson, Ann Todd, Nigel Patrick, Dinah Sheridan and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: Carrington VC
programme.desc: A decorated Army major resorts to embezzling mess funds to make ends meet - an act that leaves him facing a court martial, with the evidence stacked against him. To make matters worse, his wife sees the opportunity to get revenge for his wartime affairs by providing false testimony for the prosecution. Courtroom drama, starring David Niven, Margaret Leighton, Noelle Middleton, Laurence Naismith and Clive Morton

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the atmospheric psychological thriller Last Night in Soho

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: The war between the shape-shifting robots erupts once again, as the first of the evil Decepticons leads an attack on Earth to locate an ancient planet-destroying machine. Hapless teenager Sam Witwicky is caught in the middle of the ensuing conflict as he holds the key to discovering the location of the device. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Shia LaBeouf and Megan Fox

programme.title: Last Night in Soho Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Edgar Wright and co-writer Krysty Wilson-Cairns discuss travelling through time and recreating the past to make the atmospheric psychological thriller Last Night in Soho

programme.title: Where the Crawdads Sing
programme.desc: Catherine Kya Clark is a young woman who fends for herself in the Deep South. Chase Andrews courts her in opposition to his mother, but when he is found dead, the finger of suspicion points at Kya, so lawyer Tom Milton mounts a robust defence. Drama adapted from Delia Owens bestseller, starring Daisy Edgar-Jones, David Strathairn and Taylor John Smith

programme.title: The Night House
programme.desc: Schoolteacher Beth is devastated when her architect husband Owen takes his life, seemingly out of the blue. She wallows in grief in the lake house that Owen built for them, emotionally supported by friend and work colleague Claire and neighbour Mel. During her fitful sleeping hours, Beth experiences strange visions that suggest either she is losing her mind or there is a ghostly presence in the lake house. Supernatural psychological horror, starring Rebecca Hall, Sarah Goldberg and Vondie Curtis-Hall

programme.title: Pig
programme.desc: A chef-turned-reclusive-truffle hunter who lives alone in the Oregonian wilderness must return to his past in Portland in search of his beloved foraging pig after she is kidnapped. First-time director Michael Sarnoskis drama, starring Nicolas Cage, Alex Wolff and Adam Arkin

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: When works of art start disappearing, stolen by a master thief, Father Brown attempts to catch the culprit and save his soul. Comedy drama, starring Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood and Peter Finch

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: After being framed for murder and narrowly escaping the town mob, Jim Guthrie returns three years later to find the real killer. Western, starring Dana Andrews and Dianne Foster

programme.title: Mandy
programme.desc: A couple whose daughter was born deaf and mute decide to enrol her in a special class in the hope that she might learn to speak. The difficulties they face in raising their child expose the tensions within their marriage. Drama based on the novel The Day Is Ours by Hilda Lewis, starring Phyllis Calvert, Jack Hawkins, Mandy Miller and Terence Morgan

programme.title: Nicholas Nickleby
programme.desc: A young man is sent by his cruel uncle to work at a school, but is appalled by the brutality of the headmaster and flees with one of the abused pupils. He takes up with a troupe of travelling actors, and once more runs into his uncle, who is trying to force a woman into marriage. Period drama based on Charles Dickens novel, with Derek Bond and Cedric Hardwicke

programme.title: First Knight
programme.desc: A wandering swordsman is knighted for his fighting prowess at the court of King Arthur and his wife, Lady Guinevere. However, the new knight and the queen develop a dangerous and secret attraction for each other, while a neighbouring warlord threatens the downfall of the kingdom. Adventure, starring Richard Gere, Sean Connery, Julia Ormond and Ben Cross

programme.title: Late Night with the Devil
programme.desc: A talk show broadcast in the 70s goes horribly wrong after an exorcism is performed live. Horror, starring David Dastmalchian, Laura Gordon, Ian Bliss and Fayssal Bazzi

programme.title: Angel Has Fallen
programme.desc: Secret Service agent Mike Banning is framed for an assassination attempt on the President. Pursued by his own agency and the FBI, Banning races to clear his name and uncover the real terrorist threat - which has set its sights on Air Force One. Action thriller sequel, starring Gerard Butler and Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Isolation
programme.desc: An Irish cattle farmer facing financial problems agrees to let a scientist carry out DNA experiments on one of his cows in exchange for money, but the sinister procedure takes a disastrous turn, unleashing a genetic nightmare that will put many lives in danger. Horror, starring John Lynch, Essie Davis, Sean Harris, Marcel lures and Crispin Letts

programme.title: The Sweetest Christmas
programme.desc: Kylie, a struggling pastry chef, discovers she has secured a place in the finals of the American Gingerbread Competition. Spotting a chance to raise her profile - and perhaps jumpstart business at her new cafe - she enters, but her chances of winning are quickly slashed when her oven breaks down right before the contest. Determined to remain in the running, she appeals to her old boyfriend Nick, who gave up his education to take over his family pizzeria. He agrees to let her use his kitchens industrial ovens to craft her gingerbread delicacies, and as they pair work together, a familiar spark rekindles their old flame. Festive romance, starring Lacey Chabert and Lea Coco

programme.desc: Festive episode of the drama set in the Lancashire village of Ormston. Arthur gets into the yuletide spirit by playing pranks on son Tom, who is singularly unimpressed, while Deborah looks forward to the fresh start afforded by the new year, after the trauma of losing her baby. On a lighter note, news breaks that Santa and an elf have been on a crime spree, so local bobby Len and station-master Wilf set out to capture the dastardly duo, and decide the best way is to don disguise. After raiding Phyllis and Lindas wardrobes, the pair end up looking like Cinderellas ugly sisters. James Bolam, Michael French and Jenna Russell star, with John Henshaw, Peter Gunn, Maggie Steed and Naomi Radcliffe, plus guest appearances by Una Stubbs and Stephanie Cole

programme.title: EFL Cup Live
programme.desc: Wrexham v Cardiff City (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the fourth-round match at StoK Racecourse, as the Welsh rivals face each other for the first time since the 2001/02 season. Big-spending Wrexham were minutes away from being eliminated by Hull City in the first round, but an injury-time brace from Ollie Palmer inspired them to a penalty shootout victory, before they went on to defeat Preston North End and Reading in the following rounds. Meanwhile, the Bluebirds registered routine wins over Swindon Town and Cheltenham Town before recording a cup upset over Premier League Burnley in round three, with first-half goals by Joel Colwill and Callum Robinson inspiring a 2-1 triumph at Turf Moor. Commentary comes from Sam Matterface and Stephen Warnock, with analysis by Steven Fletcher and Robert Earnshaw, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.desc: Aaron confides in Mack about his worries with Kev, while April and Dylan put their escape plan in motion and Jacob and Matty express their concerns about Kerry

programme.title: EFL Cup Live
programme.desc: Newcastle United v Tottenham Hotspur (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch is joined by Les Ferdinand and Andrew Cole to present coverage of the fourth-round match between the Premier League rivals, which takes place at St James Park. Both of these teams entered the competition in the third round, owing to their involvement in the UEFA Champions League, with reigning champions Newcastle beating third-tier Bradford City 4-1, while Spurs also claimed a win over League One opposition as they defeated Doncaster Rovers 3-0. Commentary comes from Sam Matterface and Lucy Ward, with interviews by Gabriel Clarke

programme.title: ITV News at Ten; Weather
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITVs correspondents

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: Gallagher PREM Unleashed

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show: Special Guests
programme.desc: A look back at memorable moments from recent series of the talk show, featuring interviews with Lady Gaga, Hugh Jackman, Paul McCartney, Spice Girls, Chris Martin, Gordon Ramsay, Little Mix, Simon Pegg, Carey Mulligan and Jeremy Clarkson

programme.desc: Emotions are running high on the day of the house auction - Bernie is distraught at Shivs impending departure, Ant is depressed and Tom is sick from nerves. programme.desc: It seems the only way is the Dominican Republic! The Essex crew are back and in full holiday mode - Essexs very own Ken and Barbie, Amber and Dan, are defiant when Dan becomes the hot topic of conversation as a voice note makes the rounds insinuating that Dan got too friendly on a night out with one of Ambers least favourite people! Yaz also welcomes good friend Junaid, who is a well-known face in Essex, but where are his allegiances when it comes to his old friends Courtney, Chloe M and Amber? After back-to-back to fights with Billy, Amy is re-assessing their relationship and testing if absence really makes the heart grow fonder - she is also on hand to lend a sympathetic ear to Saff, who is about to turn 30 and is really not looking forward to this milestone birthday.

programme.desc: Mr Middleditch makes a surprise return to the hospital in the back of an ambulance, having hurt his ankle while fishing. Meanwhile, a frantic mother calls for Mikes help at a hippie commune, where her hostile husband is refusing help from the outside world. Ian Carmichael rejoins the series, which continues from earlier in the year. With Ted Robbins

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Chas and Paddy investigate Rosemarys disappearance and certain discoveries lead them to call the police. Jamies apologies fail to win over Louise and Donna is injured at work.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Vivs book launch proves to be a flop attended by only a few people, and Marlon is pleased to hear Donnas negative comments about Ross.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Sean tells Jamie hes going to be a father but refuses to name the mother. Eileen is annoyed when her friends put a damper on her relationship with Pat.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Morwennas parents Jack and Tara pay a surprise visit, having been working as missionaries in Kenya. However, the reunion is tinged with sadness when it turns out that Morwennas mother has liver cancer, and has decided against treatment because of her faith. Louisas first online call for her new course does not go as planned - especially when Martin tells the lecturer exactly what he thinks - and Joe investigates a break-in at the school where nothing has been stolen. Martin Clunes stars in the comedy drama, with Jessica Ransom, Caroline Catz, John Marquez, Kevin Doyle and Rebecca Lacey

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A patient is admitted with a fever and a swollen arm covered in black lesions, but Mike is nowhere to be seen. Blood tests confirm a case of anthrax, prompting an investigation by the Public Health Officer. Elsewhere, a specialist is summoned when a womans dizzy spells cause concern, while Alun and Lizzie are intrigued by the mysterious appearance of a young woman

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is overjoyed when he discovers a cricketing legend has checked into the pub. David inadvertently prompts a petrol crisis. Nostalgic drama, starring Derek Fowlds, David Lonsdale and Clive Mantle

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An elderly patients sudden death prompts a series of revelations about his decidedly shady past - and the raid he was planning on Ashfordly Bank. Meanwhile, Craddock is offered the chance of promotion, and Vernon embarks on yet another venture - Scripps Roaming Holidays. Nostalgic drama, starring Philip Franks, Jason Durr and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Donna is unsure whether to attend her police interview but an argument with Marlon spurs her on. Viv is upset about her poor book sales and Jamie covers his tracks over Amelia.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jamie lies to Louise about going to a wine-tasting session with Amelia - leaving his girlfriend shocked when she later spies the two together. Victoria starts receiving bullying texts.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve reads Pats text messages, which reveal the truth about the Irish charmers wife. Casey persuades Claire to attend a support group, then drops in on Ashley for another cosy chat.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Claire is feeling more positive after her support group meeting. Depressed Steve books himself a cheap holiday to Malta - only for an equally miserable Eileen to invite herself along.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Mary begins to emerge from her grief, and takes an interest in the running of the estate. However, her ambitions meet firm resistance from her father. Lady Rose MacClare, Lady Flintshires daughter, finds herself in a predicament at a tea dance in York, while Mrs Hughes urges Carson to heal an old wound. Bates comes up with a plan to help Molesley, but will it work? Costume drama, starring Michelle Dockery, Hugh Bonneville, Lily James, Phyllis Logan, Jim Carter, Brendan Coyle and Kevin Doyle

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Louisa has problems at school with Toby, Angela Sims nephew. Meanwhile, Al has a Large Whiskey order and has to ask Bert for some help, and Mrs Tishell seems to be having a delayed onset of mourning. Elsewhere, Martin and Louisa decide to try Mels suggestions of using amber beads to help James while he is teething

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: New sergeant Dennis Merton arrives at Ashfordly police station and soon finds himself embroiled in a CID stakeout - but Ventresss shady past threatens the entire operation. Meanwhile, all efforts to pummel David into the peak of physical fitness look set to come to nothing, until a chance encounter knocks Vernon for six. Nostalgic drama, starring William Simons and Duncan Bell

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Ventress has his work cut out as a series of crimes linked to an old farming feud turns deadly. But when the evidence fails to add up it is up to the bobbies to prove who is responsible before someone gets killed. Meanwhile, Vernon is inspired to screen films in the village hall. Rural police drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes, William Simons, Tricia Penrose and Jason Durr

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones investigate the cloistered world of Midsomer Priory when a nun is found strangled. The detectives uncover a complex mystery involving holy orders, teenage romantic liaisons, African art and missing antique silver as the community is forced to open its doors to 21st-century policing. Starring Neil Dudgeon and Jason Hughes, with Cliff Parisi

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: A heartbroken Sidney agrees to help parishioner Isabel prepare for her wedding to Arthur, the new man in town, but the brides stubborn mother, Daisy, proves to be a big impediment to the occasion as she believes the groom is out to kill her. When Daisy is then found dead, Mrs Maguire calls in Geordie to investigate, and Sidney finds himself dragged into the case - despite vowing to leave police business behind. While the victim seems to have died of natural causes, Arthur and Isabel are pushing for a fast cremation, suggesting the couple have something to hide. Jean Marsh and Isla Blair guest star

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Sidney is woken in the early hours by a fire in the village and, putting his life on the line, races to rescue Marion Taylor from the burning house, much to the relief of her husband Dominic. But there are questions surrounding the blaze - was it really an accident, and why was Marion so reluctant to leave? Normally Sidney would turn to Geordie to help solve a mystery like this, but he finds the detective is far from his usual self. When Dominic is then found stabbed to death, its Geordies junior, Atkins, who is sent to head up the case - and hes not exactly a fan of interfering vicars

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Tony meets an old friend at a psychology convention, and is later forced to resist her advances. The next morning she is found murdered in her hotel room, and suspicion falls on Tony since he was the last person to see her alive. Back in Bradfield, Alex hunts a serial killer targeting prostitutes, and another experimental psychologist is killed close to home. Thriller based on the novels by Val McDermid, starring Robson Green and Simone Lahbib

programme.desc: Louise admits to Terry that her date following her break-up with Jamie was a disaster and Jack is furious when Victoria goes missing on the day of her court appearance.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Matthew confronts Katie and demands to know whats happening with Perdy. Jonny suggests to Paul a date for their wedding and Ashley grows increasingly frustrated with Hilary.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Eileen and Steve arrive in Malta, where they end up having to share a room - and a bed. Back in Weatherfield, Casey continues to come between the Peacocks, while Leanne and Paul enjoy their most successful lunchtime so far.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve is confused when he wakes up next to Eileen, but perks up later when he meets sexy holiday-maker Shania - unaware she isnt all she seems. Back on the cobbles, the Peacocks realise the locals still suspect Claire of starting the fire.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: An extravagant party at the Abbey gives the Crawleys an opportunity to reunite with old friends. Some guests, however, prove more welcome than others, and alongside the celebrations come skulduggery and heartache. Includes guest appearances by Former EastEnders heart-throb Nigel Harman (Dennis Rickman) and soprano Kiri Te Kanawa, who plays the role of real-life singer Dame Nellie Melba

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Penhale decides to have a Police Open day to raise community awareness, but the only genuine visitor is an angry farmer who has had three of her sheep stolen. Meanwhile, Morwenna decides to take Al away for the weekend to try out Hannahs new glamping site, but the trip does not go well as Al accidently burns down the yurt. Elsewhere, James has started biting not only Louisa but other children at the nursery. Louisa speaks to Tina about it, but is surprised to find out Tina has spoken to their lecturer about it too

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A mysterious visitor is suspected of involvement in the theft of a priceless Ming vase. Mike tries to discover the reason for Mertons visit to headquarters and Gina starts acting like Aidensfields answer to Mata Hari. Nostalgic drama, guest starring Leslie Grantham

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A man who has not been heard of in 20 years and was presumed dead suddenly makes an appearance in Aidensfield - and seems not to have aged a day - prompting Merton to cross swords with an old adversary. Meanwhile, Vernons attempts to bring a taste of France to North Yorkshire are swiftly ruined as a wine connoisseur dishes the dirt on Scripps vineyards

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates the murder of a trainee forensic psychologist, whose body has been dumped in a Northumberland landfill site, surroundings that make evidence of how she died impossible to verify. Vera discovers that the dead woman had been working for the prison service re-investigating a crime that a former prisoner had been convicted of, and realises she must finish what the victim started in order to discover who may have wanted her dead. Paul Kaye plays a new pathologist alongside fellow guest star Peter Davison

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Sidney takes Geordie to Johnny Johnsons London jazz club, hoping to leave their worries in Grantchester for the night, but the backstage murder of Johnnys sister Claudette puts paid to that. When Archie, the victims father and owner of the club, calls in a police officer pal to crack the case, Geordie immediately detects the copper is corrupt, while Sidney makes an important discovery about Claudette that she had kept hidden from all but those closest to her. As every lead seems to come back to Archies violent past, recriminations within the family begin to play out

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: With Amanda and Guys wedding fast approaching, and his betrayal of Hildegard still fresh in his mind, Sidney is thrown deep into crisis, and the murder of a local cop doesnt help matters as he allows himself to become drawn into another case with Geordie. However, tragedy strikes as the duo close in on the killer, and with Geordies life hanging in the balance, the clergyman finds himself cut out of the investigation as the police close ranks. But that doesnt stop him enlisting the help of Mrs Maguire and Leonard in a daring mission to gather information on the man who shot his partner

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Tony becomes absorbed in a bizarre chain of murders in which each perpetrator in turn becomes the next victim, but the unusual modus operandi of beating, strangulation and shooting - always with the same gun - remains the same. Completely caught up in the case, he fails to pick up dark hints from cannibal Michael, whom he helped to convict, that he is planning to escape from the secure unit where he is held. Thriller, starring Robson Green, with Simone Lahbib and Mark Letheren

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Tinks is a disability assistance dog for her owner Charli, who has a condition that makes it painful for her to pick things up or to push and pull things. Tinks uses her super fetch skills to help Charli every day. The smallest of the Dog Squad gang, Tinks is a little Lhasa Apso with lots of big dog energy. Charli and Tinks are at WUFS - the Woofton Upcycled Fashion Show - where Charli is going to be modelling some upcycled outfits. Tinks is confused, first by upcycling; is this bicycling uphill? And then by the catwalk at the fashion show; are there going to be cats? But Charli explains that upcycling is when you turn unwanted clothes into something new. Making new outfits from old ones gives them new life and stops them going to waste. And no, there wont be any cats on the catwalk. Tinks watches as Charlis old T-shirt is transformed into a new bag. But she has to find Joe the designer in a hurry when Charli misses her mark on stage during rehearsals and track down a missing fringe after it gets accidentally swept away. And then its showtime - and time for Charli to shine. But, disaster! Charlis new bag is dropped on the catwalk, right in front of Charlis wheelchair. Tinks summons all her super fetch skills and big dog energy. Can she save the day and become a catwalk hero?
