programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Basildon, Essex, to meet nine-year-old Brandon, who suffers a severe form of epilepsy and can have up to 30 seizures a day. He requires 24-hour care and mum Jenny cant let him out of her sight for a moment - and to make matters worse, the family home simply isnt safe enough for the youngster. Luckily, the local tradesmen have heard of the familys plight and arrive in force to help Nick and the team transform the home, with designer Naomi Cleaver on hand to ensure they dont stray too far from her vision

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Swansea to meet 15-year-old Jack, who suffers from a rare form of muscular dystrophy that has led to a lifetime of painful operations. His mother Helen and older brother Daniel do all they can to help but as he grows it has become impossible to get him upstairs and now he has to sleep in the living room, leaving the rest of the family with nowhere to socialise. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team turns up to transform their three-bedroom semi, backed up by an army of local tradespeople, with designer Gabrielle Blackman on hand to ensure they dont stray too far from her vision

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Dartford to meet Scott and Jenny, whose third son Charlie was born with cerebral palsy and developmental delay. The boy needs round-the-clock care, which his mother gave up work to provide, but now he is 13, the family are struggling to cope in their small home. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team turns up to transform their end terrace, backed up by an army of local tradespeople, with designer Naomi Cleaver on hand to ensure they dont stray too far from her vision

programme.title: MasterChef Australia: Dessert Masters
programme.desc: The chefs must make a delicious dish that also moves - it might drip, turn, float, ooze or dissolve, but it will be no easy feat! The winner will claim the seasons first immunity

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Chris and Tom go to the home of a woman having suicidal thoughts and demonstrate how well trained they are at dealing with mental illness, as well as physical injury

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Cameras follow Louise, a 45-year-old mother-to-be and her estranged partner Dan, who helps her through labour. Meanwhile, Jess, 16, has always wanted a sibling, and gets more than she bargained for when her mum Elaine goes into labour at Liverpool Womens Hospital

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: First-time mum Natasha is unable to control her labour, which only heightens her anxiety, while Erika and Jez, a couple who struggled to conceive child number one, prepare for their second baby. Others include Emma and partner James, who - after she received the all-clear from a cervical cancer diagnosis - decided to lose 11 stone between them to give themselves the best chance of starting a family

programme.title: Bradford on Duty
programme.desc: With access to the frontline workers patrolling the streets, all the way up to the leaders making strategic decisions in the City Hall, this programme takes a look at those who are determined to help some of Bradfords most vulnerable residents. Cameras follow Police Constables Annabelle Pryke and Temour Ahmed as they are called to a potential abduction, following reports of a woman being dragged into a car by a man

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Today in Stoke, paramedics Mick and Rachel help a young man who has hurt his back. In Dudley, paramedics help a 74-year-old who had a shock from his internal defibrillator

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley helps people answer life-changing questions by examining their DNA. This time, Stacy meets 31-year-old Duri, who fears she may carry a potentially fatal genetic mutation and wants to test her DNA to see if she could suffer from the same disease as her mother. Elsewhere, a woman who was adopted when she was just six months old wants to use DNA technology to finally uncover information about her ancestry

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: The food writer demonstrates her favourite recipes for sharing with family and friends, including a tray of nourishing breakfast bars, a supper of crunchy chicken cutlets, and a dark and sumptuous chocolate cake. Plus she shows to make succulent belly pork burgers, which were inspired by a visit to a New York eatery

programme.title: Nick Knowles Big House Clearout
programme.desc: Nick helps a family of four in Stanwell who are paralysed by their clutter. Mum Kelly and dad Paul had always rented properties, but their first family home is now full of unnecessary furniture and items that left them feeling trapped. Nick and the team wade through hundreds of DVDs, books and toy cars to clear the mess and give mum, dad and the two kids a fresh start

The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and his crack team of builders, plasterers and electricians come to the aid of Frank and Christine Burrows in Wigan, Greater Manchester. In 2012, the Burrows 35-year-old son Mark retrained as a scaffolder to follow in his fathers footsteps, but was paralysed as the result of an unprovoked attack that left him with severe brain damage. Mark now needs constant care, but the Burrows family home is not yet fit for purpose, so Frank and Christine have been forced to take their son to a care home 15 miles away. With the help of flamboyant designer Laurence Llewelyn Bowen, Nicks experts set about constructing a self-contained apartment alongside the Burrows two-bedroom bungalow, which will provide Mark with the space, independence and security he will need to return home for good after spending two years away

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles comes to the aid of Liz and Jason Liversidge, a Hull couple in desperate need of help in future-proofing their family home. Not long after getting married and starting a family, Jason was diagnosed with both Fabrys disease, which causes a build-up of poisonous toxins in the body, and Motor Neurone Disease, which drastically reduced his life expectancy. The pair also discovered that Jason would have passed Fabrys disease on to his two daughters, which means that once her husband is gone, Liz will need all the help she can get in managing her childrens condition. Nick joins forces with designer Oliver Heath and an army of volunteers to put together a home in which Jason can build meaningful memories with his girls, but one which also gives Liz the best chance of providing for their future needs

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles is in Loughborough to meet a family of five, whose identical twin babies have been diagnosed as having a form of dwarfism, while at the age of 41, dad Mark is recovering from aggressive bowel and liver cancer. Now they are struggling for space. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team turns up to transform their home, backed up by an army of local tradespeople, with designer Gabrielle Blackman on hand to ensure they dont stray too far from her vision

programme.title: MasterChef Australia: Dessert Masters
programme.desc: In the first elimination of the season, the chefs must impress with desserts that trick the eye by appearing to be something else, while ensuring flavour is front and centre

programme.title: The Secret World of Posh Pets
programme.desc: Peoples high-end pampering of their pets, detailing the extent to which some take their affection for their much-loved and respected animals. American miniature horse shows are only just starting up in the United Kingdom, however for Lisa and her daughter, who own over 30 horses, spend thousands on outfits and travel the world searching for the perfect horse, attending such events is already a way of life. Plus, a visit to Wiltshires Lucknam Park Hotel and Spa, an elegant retreat whose wealthy guests - whether two-legged or four - are treated like royalty

programme.title: The Secret World of Posh Pets
programme.desc: Just aged 21, Rory has already cornered the market in supplying pet jellyfish. He is so successful that he now employs his father to help him export his jellies all around the world. His latest project is his biggest yet, installing a massive tank in a high-end electrical shop and settling five rare Japanese nettle jellies into their new home. Plus, how blingtastic dog grooming is spreading to horses, with no childs pony party complete without a purple unicorn with spangle stars and nail polish on its hooves

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: With their first baby on the way, tattooed lady Sazzie and her scary biker boyfriend Adam hope theyll be judged like any other parents and not because of how they look. Cameras also follow Jen, who suffers from Crohns disease, and ex-soldier John as they look forward to the birth of their first child

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.sub-title: Hugo and the Ice Cream Pups
programme.desc: Pete meets some newborn pups fighting to survive, and helps teach Hugo, a Cane Corso rescued from quarantine at Dover, how to be a dog

programme.title: Bradford on Duty
programme.desc: With access to the frontline workers patrolling the streets all the way up to the leaders making strategic decisions in the City Hall, the final episode examines how the NHS is trying to relieve pressure on hospitals by caring for patients in their own homes. Cameras follow community matrons Sandra and Julia on their morning rounds, and their first patient of the morning is found at home in pain

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics are sent to help a 49-year-old who has fallen in the street after a night out in Stoke, while in Dudley, paramedics visit a five-month-old who has a temperature

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Forty-six-year-old Mel only found out as a teenager that she was conceived using a sperm donor. Now she wants to see if she can find her biological fathers identity by decoding her DNA, and discovers far more than she ever expected. Fi always knew she was adopted, but what she didnt know until later in life was that her father murdered her birth mother. Fi wants to know if it possible to inherit a murder gene. Presented by Stacey Dooley

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson demonstrates dishes that combine the comfort of the familiar with the excitement of the new, including fluffy oat pancakes drizzled with a raspberry and honey syrup. She offers a twist on a classic Caesar salad for a light lunch idea, and rustles up a Greek-inspired supper for friends including squid and orzo pasta, and a sweet and savoury version of a cheesecake. Nigellas simple rice bowl with ginger, radish and avocado celebrates a few choice ingredients and results in a dish thats uplifting to look at, as well as to eat

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a thousand-mile journey from the Swedish capital of Stockholm to Abisko in the northern reaches of the Arctic Circle. In Stockholm, Michael braves a precarious tour of the city from its rooftops before boarding a heritage tram to get the lowdown on 1930s Sweden from an expert. Moving on, he finishes his journey deep in the Arctic Circle at a remote climate research station. He also has lunch with traditional Sami people in Vilhelmina and checks into an ice hotel

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo takes a trip in a Second World War Spitfire above Biggin Hill aerodrome, and takes the train to East Grinstead on the trail of Winnie the Pooh. He also visits Plaw Hatch Farm, 200 acres of community-owned farmland that operates biodynamically according to principles first laid out in the 1920s

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Hassocks and makes his way to the beautiful Sussex village of Ditchling, where a Roman Catholic community of artists once made their home. Next, he visits the seaside town of Bexhill-on-Sea, before the Kent and East Sussex heritage railway conveys Michael from Bodiam Castle through the scenic Rother Valley to Tenterden, and finally arrives in the village of Benenden

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: As Hitlers shadow engulfs Europe, ancient castles across the continent fall under Nazi control and are transformed to serve the ambitions of the Third Reich

programme.title: Nuremberg: Nazis on Trial
programme.desc: Series recreating the court cases of three of the Second World Wars most notorious Nazis, using eyewitness interviews and archive footage, as well as considering the interviews they underwent at the hands of lawyers and psychologists. The first episode focuses on the trial of Albert Speer, Hitlers chief architect and armaments minister, regarded by many as a good Nazi. Nathaniel Parker stars

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce introduces a selection of unscreened items from recent shows. Among the fascinating finds are a garnet and diamond cross believed by the owner to have been gifted by Marie Antoinette en route to the guillotine, and a suitcase of unopened letters from an imprisoned First World War soldier that finally reveal their secrets. Plus, an arts-and-crafts casket once intended to be the final resting place of a womans ashes

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Oxburgh Hall in Norfolk, where they assess finds including family heirlooms that honour the men of the Pathfinder Squadron who fought in the Second World War. Plus, a 300-year-old treasure box packed with surprises and a set of discarded postcards

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dereks on his way to Blackpool to pick up what will be the highest priced item at the next auction. But, the 1970 Aston Martin DBS needs a tow to the local garage

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Over the years Derek has learnt to always expect the unexpected. So when Call the Midwife star Cliff Parisi drops off his Bedford CA campervan its just another day at the office

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: As Hitlers shadow engulfs Europe, ancient castles across the continent fall under Nazi control and are transformed to serve the ambitions of the Third Reich

programme.title: Nuremberg: Nazis on Trial
programme.desc: Series recreating the court cases of three of the Second World Wars most notorious Nazis, using eyewitness interviews and archive footage, as well as considering the interviews they underwent at the hands of lawyers and psychologists. The first episode focuses on the trial of Albert Speer, Hitlers chief architect and armaments minister, regarded by many as a good Nazi. Nathaniel Parker stars

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce introduces a selection of unscreened items from recent shows. Among the fascinating finds are a garnet and diamond cross believed by the owner to have been gifted by Marie Antoinette en route to the guillotine, and a suitcase of unopened letters from an imprisoned First World War soldier that finally reveal their secrets. Plus, an arts-and-crafts casket once intended to be the final resting place of a womans ashes

programme.title: Sacred Rivers with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer travels to China for a trip along the Yangtze, Asias longest river and the third longest in the world. He follows the route to Dazu, where he sees 50,000 ancient rock carvings, some of the only religious artefacts not to have been destroyed under communist rule. He then takes a river cruise to the Three Gorges Dam - the biggest power station on the planet - before ending his journey in Shanghai, a shining symbol of Chinas new economic might and a city where many are rediscovering religious faith

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus take on a Mazda MX-5 thats been given some real boy racer attitude, hoping to return it to its former glory

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The Restos team try their hardest not to go too far on an Opel Manta. And a Peugeot 205 GTI brings back happy B-road memories for a mechanic who owned one

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dereks on his way to Blackpool to pick up what will be the highest priced item at the next auction. But, the 1970 Aston Martin DBS needs a tow to the local garage

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring Old Byron Hot Springs in the Californian desert - a once glittering Hollywood hotspot, converted into a top-secret interrogation centre

programme.title: Sacred Rivers with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer travels to China for a trip along the Yangtze, Asias longest river and the third longest in the world. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo follows his 1930s Bradshaws guide to the unspoilt East Sussex port of Rye, where he learns about the loss of a generation of lifeboatmen in 1928. On the beaches at Rye, Michael explores one of 28,000 pillboxes constructed around the British coastline during the Second World War, before boarding the Romney, Hythe and Dymchurch railway to Dungeness

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: From the Kent Cinque Port of Deal, Michael Portillo heads to Walmer Castle, home during the 1920s to Lord Beauchamp, whose openly homosexual lifestyle led to his exile from the country. And in Margate, Michael discovers the connection to TS Eliot

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Herne Bay to Leeds Castle, Kent
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches the Kent seaside resort of Herne Bay, where he learns about a pioneering aviatrix who began her working life as a typist in Hull. In the seaside town of Whitstable, he tucks into its famous staple, oysters. Michael later crosses the North Downs to Lenham, and visits Leeds Castle

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his travels in Greater London, beginning on its south-eastern fringe in the village of Chislehurst and ending up in Kennington to learn about the childhood of Charlie Chaplin

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Three MGs from the 70s turn up at the garage, still covered in original factory wax. Nobody can believe it, or value them. A Morris 1000 turns up at the auction along with a TR7 V8

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: A Secret to Win the War
programme.desc: In 1942, a mysterious technology is facilitating a deadly Blitz. Desperate for answers, British intelligence sets its sights on an installation in Bruneval, France

programme.title: Nuremberg: Nazis on Trial
programme.desc: Dramatisation of the trial of Luftwaffe chief and designated successor to Hitler, Hermann Goering. The larger-than-life character was renowned for his charisma and flamboyance, but also as one of the most unrepentant and ruthless of all Nazis. Having aimed to use the courtroom as a means of rehabilitating the fascist regime, it was only at a late stage that he was forced to concede defeat. Robert Pugh stars

programme.title: EFL Cup Live
programme.desc: Wrexham v Cardiff City (Kick-off 8.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the fourth-round match at StoK Racecourse, as the Welsh rivals face each other for the first time since the 2001/02 season. Big-spending Wrexham were minutes away from being eliminated by Hull City in the first round, but an injury-time brace from Ollie Palmer inspired them to a penalty shootout victory, before they went on to defeat Preston North End and Reading in the following rounds. Meanwhile, the Bluebirds registered routine wins over Swindon Town and Cheltenham Town before recording a cup upset over Premier League Burnley in round three, with first-half goals by Joel Colwill and Callum Robinson inspiring a 2-1 triumph at Turf Moor. Commentary comes from Sam Matterface and Stephen Warnock, with analysis by Steven Fletcher and Robert Earnshaw, and reports from Gabriel Clarke

programme.desc: The crimes of Allan Legere, who in 1989 brutally ended the lives of four defenceless residents in his home community of the Miramichi, New Brunswick. Having been convicted of murder three years previously, Legere had escaped from prison during a hospital visit and remained on the run for six months. Intent on revenge, he returned to his home town, hiding out in the woods during daylight but stalking the community at night. Dubbed The Miramichi Monster, Legeres ultimate act of revenge was the murder of his local catholic priest

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: The staff are excited by the arrival of a TV film crew at the hospital, especially Mr Harper, who is desperate to be caught on camera - and it looks like his dreams of stardom may be about to come true when Mr Middleditch gives him an important job for the broadcast. Elsewhere, the atmosphere is much more tense, as Dr Ormerod and nurse Meryl Taylor are called out to help a boy who has been trapped below the surface of an icy lake for 20 minutes - and to make matters worse, the ambulance carrying the unconscious lad back to hospital gets caught in a snowdrift. On a lighter note, Ray Piper is brought in with a huge bump on his head - and theres much hilarity when it turns out his wife has hit him with a frozen turkey. But before the day is out, hes not the only member of his family to be admitted. Festive special of the hospital drama, guest starring DJ Simon Bates as TV presenter Lennie Lamarr, with Robert Daws, Wendy Craig and Anna Madeley

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.desc: The sleuthing spinster teams up with a dashing man to investigate a series of poison-pen letters in the sleepy village of Lymstock. Two of the missives have led to the deaths of Mona Symmington, the wife of Lymstock solicitor Richard, and Agnes Woddell, the parlour maid at the Symmingtons house. However, Miss Marple suspects there is more to these deaths than meets the eye. Murder mystery with an all-star cast, featuring Geraldine McEwan, James DArcy, Emilia Fox, Imogen Stubbs, Ken Russell, Harry Enfield and Kelly Brook

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Former EastEnder and The Bill bad cop Todd Carty guest stars in this festive special of the rural drama. He plays an old army pal of Lord Ashfordly who moves into the hall while the peer is sunning himself in Bermuda, claiming hes there to keep an eye on the place after rumours of a planned break-in. However, he arouses the polices suspicions when he becomes involved with a teenage tearaway who seems to think Christmas isnt so much about giving and receiving as taking without the owners permission. Elsewhere in the village, Blaketon and Peggy go into competition with rival Santas grottos, and Ventress has his nose put out of joint when his friends draw straws to see wholl invite him to Christmas dinner while his wifes in hospital

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is brought in to investigate when a former Met police officer is stabbed to death outside a nightclub in Newcastle. The team initially suspects a crime of passion after it emerges the victim had recently rekindled his affair with his childhood sweetheart, whose husband has a history of violence. However, Vera uncovers evidence pointing to a more complex case involving inside information and the hostile takeover of a brewery. What did the deceased find out that cost him his life? Guest starring Jill Halfpenny, Christine Bottomley, Ralph Ineson and Liam Cunningham

They attempt to answer general knowledge questions and confusing conundrums, with only one team making it through to the high-stakes final with a chance to win a cash prize

programme.title: Dark Side of Reality TV
programme.desc: A hard look at the popular show Extreme Makeover: Home Edition, which was known for gifting homes to families in need, transforming their lives with beautiful new spaces. However, behind the feel-good moments, there is a hidden reality that many never see. Viewers never witnessed how the houses became money-pits, that led to family fallout and massive debt

programme.title: Dinner with the Enemy
programme.desc: How will the Head of the Table wield the power and control they have been secretly afforded? One diner leaves the conversation as a new diner joins

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Dubai
programme.desc: The countdown begins for Caroline Stanburys wedding day, but not before she clears up some issues with Lesa at an afternoon of high tea...

programme.title: The Real Housewives of Dubai
programme.desc: Nina worries as her fathers condition worsens back home, and Caroline Stanbury and Sergios parents come face to face for the first time.

programme.title: OAP BandB
programme.desc: Documentary following what happens when elderly homeowners are paired up with young renters for two weeks. For the OAP, its a chance to combat the everyday loneliness of living in an empty house and for the younger person, its a chance to live rent free in return for their time and some chores. At the end of two intensive weeks, they will each decide if they are willing to move in together and make the living arrangement permanent. This episode features Davis and Colette
